Title: Postdoctoral Associate CY (Matthews)
Description:
Job Description

Applications are invited for a Postdoctoral Associate position with the Department of Mathematics at Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA. The position involves research in algebraic coding theory and cryptography, especially code-based cryptography, and teaching one class per semester.

Required Qualifications
PhD in Mathematics or a related field with a background in algebraic coding theory or post-quantum cryptography is required. PhD must be awarded no more than four years prior to the effective date of appointment with a minimum of one year eligibility remaining.Research in applied algebraSolid background in function fields or curves over finite fieldsDemonstrated ability to working effectively with a diverse teamDemonstrated ability or potential to lead graduate student researchTrack record in publishing in high-impact peer-reviewed journals or conferences.Strong communication skills
Appointment Type

Restricted

Salary Information

Commensurate with experience

Review Date

12/16/2021

Additional Information

The successful candidate will be required to have a criminal conviction check.

About Virginia Tech

Dedicated to its motto, Ut Prosim (That I May Serve), Virginia Tech pushes the boundaries of knowledge by taking a hands-on, transdisciplinary approach to preparing scholars to be leaders and problem-solvers. A comprehensive land-grant institution that enhances the quality of life in Virginia and throughout the world, Virginia Tech is an inclusive community dedicated to knowledge, discovery, and creativity. The university offers more than 280 majors to a diverse enrollment of more than 36,000 undergraduate, graduate, and professional students in eight undergraduate colleges , a school of medicine , a veterinary medicine college, Graduate School , and Honors College . The university has a significant presence across Virginia, including the Innovation Campus in Northern Virginia; the Health Sciences and Technology Campus in Roanoke; sites in Newport News and Richmond; and numerous Extension offices and research centers . A leading global research institution, Virginia Tech conducts more than $500 million in research annually.

Virginia Tech does not discriminate against employees, students, or applicants on the basis of age, color, disability, sex (including pregnancy), gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, or military status, or otherwise discriminate against employees or applicants who inquire about, discuss, or disclose their compensation or the compensation of other employees or applicants, or on any other basis protected by law.

If you are an individual with a disability and desire an accommodation, please contact (Kayla Perkins) at (kaybc8@vt.edu) during regular business hours at least 10 business days prior to the event.

Title: Research Assistant
Description:
Lawrence Berkeley National Lab’s ( LBNL ) Physics Division has an opening for a Research Assistant to join the team.

In this exciting role, you will assist with the development and implementation of protocols for error mitigation and of quantum algorithms for high energy physics on real and simulated quantum computers.

What You Will Do
 Translate algorithms into code that can be deployed efficiently on current quantum computers.  Develop and maintain software packages for error mitigation and quantum algorithms.  Perform quantum computer simulations and analyze data from current quantum computers.  Write detailed notes on all progress made on assignments.  Provide status reports to supervisor. 
What Is Required
 B.S. degree or equivalent experience.  Programming experience in Python.  Knowledge of quantum mechanics.  Ability to follow step by step instructions to complete assignments in a timely manner.  Ability to document any progress made.  Good interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.  Ability to work as a team member. 
Desired Qualifications
 Coursework in quantum computing.  Experience with quantum computing software (Qiskit, Cirq, PyQuil, etc.). 
Notes
 This is a full time, 1 year, term appointment with the possibility of extension based upon satisfactory job performance, continuing availability of funds and ongoing operational needs.  This position is represented by a union for collective bargaining purposes.  Salary will be determined based on range by collective bargaining agreement.  This position may be subject to a background check. Any convictions will be evaluated to determine if they directly relate to the responsibilities and requirements of the position. Having a conviction history will not automatically disqualify an applicant from being considered for employment.  Work will be primarily performed at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, 1 Cyclotron Road, Berkeley, CA. 
Based on University of California Policy - SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) Vaccination Program and U.S Federal Government requirements, Berkeley Lab requires that all members of our community obtain the COVID-19 vaccine as soon as they are eligible. As a condition of employment at Berkeley Lab, all Covered Individuals must Participate in the COVID-19 Vaccination Program by providing proof that vaccination requirements have been met or submitting a request for Exception or Deferral. Visit covid.lbl.gov for more information.

Berkeley Lab is committed to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Accountability (IDEA) and strives to continue building community with these shared values and commitments. Berkeley Lab is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We heartily welcome applications from women, minorities, veterans, and all who would contribute to the Lab's mission of leading scientific discovery, inclusion, and professionalism. In support of our diverse global community, all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or protected veteran status.

Equal Opportunity And IDEA Information Links

Title: Research Associate
Description:
Required Qualifications

A Ph.D. in Physics/Chemistry (or a related field) at the time of application is required.

The successful candidate must demonstrate prior evidence of relevant expertise, and/or an outstanding research record of accomplishment in computational condensed matter or quantum chemistry.

Title: QAMSS SRI Coordinator and Business Developer
Description:
The Quantum and Advanced Materials technologies for a Sustainable Society (QAMSS) Strategic Research Initiative (SRI) brings together Cambridge minds to facilitate collaboration across disciplines, improve Cambridge visibility, and coordinate large strategic grants. QAMSS facilitates collaborations via working group members representing complementary activities. Examples include: Interdisciplinary Research Centres (Cambridge Centre for Data Driven-Discovery, Energy, Neurosciences, Synthetic Biology); Strategic Research Initiatives (Global Challenges, Trust in Technology); Strategic Research Networks (Digital Humanities); and Cross-School Initiatives (Cambridge Digital Humanities, Cambridge Zero, Centre for Digital Built Britain). These are distinctive in supporting a sustainable society.

The QAMSS-SRI Coordinator and Business Developer reports to, and supports, the SRI Co-Chairs (Professors Atature, Ferrari and Gibson, based at the Departments of Physics and Engineering) and the QAMSS Steering Committee to develop the ongoing strategy for the initiative and manages the SRI team to implement and deliver the required activities. The role-holder actively grows and manages relations with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure that the mutually agreed aims are met. A key element of the role is to communicate business needs and market drivers from industry. This includes business development work for the Graphene Flagship and the Cambridge Graphene Centre (CGC), accounting for 50% of the time.

Based in West Cambridge, the SRI coordinator will be expected to spend part of their time in the departments and centers supporting the SRI initiative and organize inclusive activities and meetings using their local facilities. The SRI Chairs and Steering Committee members will ensure office and meeting spaces are available for the SRI Coordinator to use.

The successful applicant will hold a degree level qualification in a scientific or technical subject relevant to the role's remit, at PhD Level or equivalent. Significant experience in dealing with new product and/or process development for industry is required, as well as previous exposure to company dynamics and the capability to bridge the gap between research and business goals. Knowledge of the patenting process, licensing or other aspects of technology transfer and experience in new business development and setting B2B or academic-industry collaborations is needed. Excellent communication and IT skills are essential, including the ability to produce and update webpages. Knowledge of IP management criteria and experience in negotiation and handling collaborations and reporting within UK and EU projects is highly desirable.

The QAMSS SRI and CGC actively promote policies to address historic under-representation of women and minority groups in the Cambridge workforce. The departments of Physics and Engineering are proud to hold Athena-SWAN Gold and Silver Awards, respectively, for our work on equality, diversity and inclusion (ED&I). Applicants from under-represented groups, as well as candidates with a track record in addressing ED&I issues in research and education, are particularly encouraged to apply.

Fixed-term: The funds for this post are available for 3 years in the first instance.

Click the 'Apply' button below to register an account with our recruitment system (if you have not already) and apply online.

Please ensure that you upload your Curriculum Vitae (CV) and a covering letter in the Upload section of the online application.

The closing date for applications is Monday 27 June 2022. If you have any questions about this vacancy please contact Professor Andrea Ferrari (acf26@cam.ac.uk), Professor Val Gibson (gibson@hep.phy.cam.ac.uk) or Professor Mete Atature (ma424@cam.ac.uk) For any questions on the application process, please contact the HR Office at the Department of Engineering (hr-office@eng.cam.ac.uk, +44 (0)1223 332615).

Please quote reference NM30534 on your application and in any correspondence about this vacancy.

The University actively supports equality, diversity and inclusion and encourages applications from all sections of society.

The University has a responsibility to ensure that all employees are eligible to live and work in the UK.

Further information
Further Particulars Apply online

Title: Intern Tech Research & Development -6G
Description:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~14,000 employees create world-class solutions in wireless communications, 5G, automotive, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100’s Best Companies List and we are “Great Place to Work” Certified. We’re driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight – People and Culture - YouTube

Job Description

What you will be doing

Want to be at the cutting edge of Research and Development? Join the Aalborg team that’s taking world leading Keysight electronics products from wild idea in proof of concept.

As a student in telecom Engineering with an interest in AI/ML or student in AI/ML technologies with an interest in Telecom you will be involved with the transformation of test and measurement idea into the development of proof of concept. This work is happening in the corporate research Labs facility in Aalborg (Novy) where a young & dynamic team is settled.

You understand or want to learn more about 6G? You want to apply your skills in solving real 6G challenges? Then this internship is for you!

6G brings a new set of challenges around using AI/ML technologies in different area of the network, air interface and core network optimization. These techniques will need to be tested and validated. For this, the current state of the art needs to be understood and new methodologies will need to be developed, applied and validated.

You will solve a broad range of Telecom problems in the disaggregate network test space. The work is of varying scope and complexity and will expose you to what engineers do on a day to day basis in a research lab.

The amounts of hours you work with us is flexible and take into account your study requirements. We intend to work with you until you graduate.

The project you work on will be part of an existing team project where you can cooperate with experienced engineers from Denmark and the UK. The work can be also combined with your Bachelor or Master thesis projects as part of your education.

Who Are We Looking For

We are looking for an enthusiast Bachelor or Master level student candidate, fluent in English (written and oral) with a passion to work on advanced test and measurement challenges.

As future Telecom or AI/ML engineer you would like to apply the knowledge you have gathered in your education in real conditions. You are interested in looking into big data problems, identify trends and create analysis tools.

You must be studying in one of the local Aalborg faculty to be taken into account for this position. There is no relocation package or support for relocation as part of this position.

Title: Research Intern, PhD, Fall 2022
Description:
Please complete your application before August 26th, 2022. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in the United States for the duration of the internship program. 

NOTE: This internship is intended for students who are pursuing a PhD degree with an anticipated graduation date before December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; Ann Arbor, MI, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Chapel Hill, NC, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Irvine, CA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Madison, WI, USA; New York, NY, USA; Palo Alto, CA, USA; Portland, OR, USA; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; San Bruno, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Washington, DC, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; Princeton, NJ, USA.

Minimum qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a PhD degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or a similar area.).

Preferred qualifications:
Currently attending a degree program in the US.Availability to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term. Ability to return to a degree program after completion of the internship.Relevant experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.Experience contributing research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages.Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About The Job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns aren't cloistered in the lab, but instead they work closely with Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, and much more.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

Develop and execute a research agenda. Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Research Fellow (Quantum Information Processing),Centre For Quantum Technologies
Description:
About The Centre For Quantum Technologies

The Centre for Quantum Technologies (CQT) is a research centre of excellence in Singapore. It brings together physicists, computer scientists and engineers to do basic research on quantum physics and to build devices based on quantum phenomena. Experts in this new discipline of quantum technologies are applying their discoveries in computing, communications, and sensing. CQT is hosted by the National University of Singapore and also has staff at Nanyang Technological University. With some 180 researchers and students, it offers a friendly and international work environment. Learn more about CQT at www.quantumlah.org

Job Description
The successful candidate will work as part of a collaborative programme between the Centre for Quantum Technologies and Oxford University to develop quantum dot-based quantum light sources for distributed photonic networks for future quantum information processing.Significant experience of quantum optics or spectroscopy of devices, materials, or nanomaterials is essential and should be accompanied with a demonstrable track record of assembling and operating optical set-ups, lasers, APDs, time-resolved spectroscopy, helium flow cryostats, and control software (e.g. Labview). Knowledge of exciton dynamics and material synthesis is an advantage because the appointee will be expected to contribute to sample fabrication.The appointment is for an initial period of one year, renewable subject to performance.
Job Requirements
Applicants should possess or be close to obtaining a PhD in physics or materials science.Highly experienced in the optoelectronic characterisation of devices, materials, and nanomaterials.Experience with optical spectroscopy.Experience with laboratory experimental automation software, particularly LabVIEW.Good track record of high-quality publications.Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.Applicants should be highly motivated and have excellent skills in working collaboratively as part of a team.The ability to direct your own research and interpret your results independently.Applicants are expected to openly share information pertaining to their research with other group members and contribute to scientific discussions concerning their and other group members' work.Experience with time-resolved spectroscopy of materials.Experience with handling cryogens and work at low temperatures.Experience with experiments and/or analysis related to single photon countingExperience working with wet-bench chemistry for material synthesis
More Information

For enquiries and details about the position, please contact Tristan Farrow at  [email protected]  . Please include your consent by filling in the NUS Personal Data Consent for Job Applicants. Employment Type : Full-time Applications can be submitted via the link below and should contain: the latest CV, and letter of recommendation (if any). Job requisition ID : [[11859]]

Additional Information

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required. With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated for successful employment with NUS. MOM Updated advisory on COVID-vaccination at the Workplace, subject to changes in accordance with the national COVID-19 measures

Qualification

Doctorate (PhD)

Title: Research Staff Member - Quantum (Any Location)
Description:
521558BR

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM Quantum is building an equitable, diverse, and inclusive global quantum computing ecosystem. IBM Quantum is developing full-stack quantum computing, consisting of all relevant hardware and software solutions. We are looking for a researcher to join the “Quantum Algorithms and Complexity Research” team that works on topics such as design and analysis of quantum algorithms, quantum computational complexity theory, formal investigation of quantum advantage, as well as experimental implementation and demonstration of quantum advantage. The focus of the group is on determining areas where quantum computers have a potential advantage, understanding, developing and improving quantum algorithms, and studying quantum computational complexity. Collaboration with other members of the broader IBM Quantum team is encouraged. Responsibilities include developing quantum algorithms, providing formal evidence for quantum advantage, and advancing the understanding of problems that can be sped up by quantum computers.

This position can be located anywhere in the US.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or a closely related fieldProven expertise in quantum computingProven record of research achievements

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Proven record of design and analysis of quantum algorithmsExperience with rigorous results in quantum computational complexity theory

About Business Unit

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science.

This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Title: IBM Quantum Services Learning Strategist (Any Location in the US)
Description:
566343BR

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

Responsibilities Include

Quantum computers are incredibly powerful machines that take a new approach to processing information. Built on the principles of quantum mechanics, they exploit complex and fascinating laws of nature that are always there, but usually remain hidden from view. By harnessing such natural behavior, quantum computers can run new types of algorithms to process information more holistically. They may one day lead to revolutionary breakthroughs in materials and drug discovery, the optimization of complex man made systems, and artificial intelligence. We expect them to open doors that we once thought would remain locked indefinitely. IBM Quantum is looking for a Learning Strategist to build our quantum services offering portfolio elements for enterprise industry client education and learning. You will define differentiated learning curriculums, work with solutioning and delivery teams to curate the learning content and plans for each client, and collaborate across a network of IBM Quantum industry, research and systems experts to build upon and further accelerate IBM leadership in the market.

 Lead development of a market differentiated learning curriculum for enterprise industry clients spanning multiple modes of content delivery (Qiskit textbook elements, live/recorded lectures, learning assets, Jupyter/python notebooks, etc.) Consult with delivery teams and clients to ensure a talent development strategy is in place for each client to achieve quantum readiness Manage full learning cycle, curriculum design, development, execution and review while ensuring client satisfaction Assist with building a portfolio of quantum services education offerings that reflects a strong focus on how clients will experience and consume the offering along with a scalable path to deliver consistent, repeatable outcomes Enable and support IBM Quantum team to sell and deliver the offering by onboarding clients and participating in critical client meetings, embracing client insights back into continual improvement of the curriculum and content Global travel may be required once we return to a travel-safe normal.

This position can be located anywhere in the US.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

 Emerging technology and strategy background combined with a Bachelors/Masters in STEM related field with deep knowledge in quantum computation, quantum information or quantum physics Strong understanding of industry use applications of quantum computing 3+ years of experience in strong business and technology strategy consulting 3+ years of experience in strong ideation, facilitation and communications skills 3+ years of experience in consultative learning and education strategy Readiness to travel Up to 4 days a week

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

 5+ years of experience in strong business and technology strategy consulting 5+ years of experience in strong ideation, facilitation and communications skills 5+ years of experience in consultative learning and education strategy

With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.

Title: Content Designer Quantum (Remote)
Description:
558840BR

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM Quantum is leading the world in an incredible new computing paradigm based on quantum technology. To bring the story of our remarkable quantum technology to the world we are building a dedicated, highly creative experience team to create beautiful, engaging content and experiences for our audiences.

IBM Quantum is looking for a Content Designer/Technical Copywriter to add to the team. You’d be part of the Experience Team whose mission is to leverage design to transform the way IBM Quantum works and interacts with our clients. You’d collaborate with the IBM Quantum Consulting team and IBM Research to design the experience we want our clients to have as they partner with us to pursue quantum applications in their industries. You’d be a key member of a multi-disciplinary squad focused on using design thinking and service design practices to create and iterate on how we take quantum to market in various industry categories.

 Conceive and execute strategic content consistent with agreed upon strategy. Responsible for original concepts that demonstrate clear, concise and convincing writing with grammatical and material accuracy. Translate complex technical terms and concepts into easy to digest language for audiences ranging from the C-suite to developers. Engage in content development initiatives focused on building employee knowledge and skills in specific areas of expertise through coaching and development of training course material. Develop concepts and/or content, producing scripts, concept decks and final copy as required. See work through to production/publishing.

Preferred Location is Remote.

bhm2020

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

 Excellent creative, conceptual, communication, facilitation and problem-solving skills. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, including techniques to persuade and negotiate. Strong experience taking complex technical language and distilling it into user-friendly terms for broader audiences. The ability to articulate alternative approaches. Outstanding storytelling and presentation skills. Empathetic and attuned to users’ needs, motivations and behaviors. Team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to take a leadership role when necessary. Experience writing for a developer audience. Must also be able to work productively and harmoniously as a teammate with design leads, content leads, visual designers and copywriters who share the responsibility on the given assignment. Natural curiosity and comfort with ambiguity accompanied by an extreme willingness for continuous learning. Exceptional attention to detail.

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

 Bachelor’s degree 5+ years of copywriting or technical writing Portfolio that displays strong writing work

Title: Research Scientist, Life Cycle Assessment
Description:
Are you interested in life cycle assessment and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Would you like to work with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field and build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you.
VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2000 brilliant minds is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation.
We are now looking for Research Scientist to join our Industrial Circular Economy team.
As a research scientist, your key goals are working with environmental and circular impacts assessment for manufacturing and materials solutions, example for batteries and electrification. In this position, you will have an essential role in selected research projects to assess life cycle impacts of the processes and products, and later grow as expert in circular design.
Our team, Industrial Circular Economy, is working with environmental, economic and material related aspects of circular solutions. We work example with lifetime extension strategies, material recycling and waste.
Read more about our research:https://www.vttresearch.com/en/ourservices/industrial-circular-economy-and-ecodesign
As Research Scientist, life cycle assessment you will: With us, you are assessing environmental and circularity impacts, and working with customers in the Finnish battery value chain, process industry and manufacturing industry.Also dynamic modelling of material flows and environmental impacts will be later your responsibilities.You will also develop computational eco-design modelling as a research topic with us.
Who we are looking for:We are looking you to have few years experience (from studies and/or work) in life cycle assessment (materials, process industry or manufacturing industry) and good mathematical and computational skillsKnowledge of materials or chemistry or manufacturing is preferential.We are looking for person with Master’s Degree in materials or environmental engineering or related technical fieldGood English writing and digital skills are expected. Most of the work in near future is in national scale, so Finnish skills, as a spoken and written, is preferential.
As a person, we hope that you are:good in numbers, experienced in life-cycle assessment, including basic modelling skills for dynamic material flow analysisefficient team worker, well-organized and pro-activegood in communication and customer work
With VTT, you’ll enjoy:Natural sciences with an impact. VTT works on the cutting-edge of natural sciences, and we’ve invested into building state-of-the-art research facilities for natural sciences, such as the Bioruukki pilot infrastructure for bio- and circular economy. Our research agenda is dedicated to solving systemic and technological challenges, such as reaching carbon neutrality and unleashing the power of synthetic biology. That means that at VTT, your expertise in natural sciences will go towards creating real impact. Read more about our strategy – the path of exponential hope.Superb colleagues and community. With VTT, you’ll join a community of over 2000 multidisciplinary experts who foster a culture of trust, openness and sharing knowledge. We work truly across disciplines, and house all the cutting-edge sciences from quantum computing to synthetic biology under one roof. Collaborating with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.Excellent career in research. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us over 10 years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. A combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects keeps your career path interesting.Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture great team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work–life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation programmes and trainings on cognitive ergonomics.
Apply now and join our community of brilliant minds!
Please send your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible but at the latest by 31 May 2022. We will process applications as they come in, and fill in the position as soon as we find the right candidate.
Interested and want to hear more?For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Päivi Kivikytö-Reponen, paivi.kivikyto-reponen@vtt.fi, 040-4835785 on 16.5.13-14, 18.5. 13.30-14.30 or 19.5. 14-15.
We look forward to hearing from you!
Location: Location Future HUB, Espoo or Tampere.
Apply between 12 May 2022 and 31 May 2022 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)Employment type: Fulltime, permanent

Title: Quantum Applications Research Mngr (San Jose, CA or Ykt Heights, NY)
Description:
562455BR

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM Quantum is building an equitable, diverse, and inclusive global quantum computing ecosystem.

IBM Research seeks a first line applications research manager to join our quantum computing team at the Almaden Research Center in San Jose, CA or in Yorktown Heights, NY.

We are seeking a first line manager for our quantum applications research team. Candidates are expected to manage a team of diverse researchers who carry out high-impact quantum theoretical and applications research. Fruitful collaboration with other teams across the globe is expected. Manager and client experience is preferred. A Ph.D. in Quantum Information, Physics, Chemistry, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related area is preferred.

Location is San Jose, CA or Yorktown Heights, NY

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

 At least 2 years of experience in quantum computing theory or applications research At least 5 years research experience in field of expertise Proven record of research and accomplishment

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

 PhD in relevant field Experience with people management and client related-activities

About Business Unit

With more than 3,000 researchers in 12 labs located across six continents, IBM Research brings together hundreds of researchers who possess unparalleled industry expertise to address some of the world's most challenging problems. Join us as we do pioneering work in areas such as cognitive computing, augmented intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain, to name a few.

This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.

Your Life @ IBM

Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Title: Research Intern, PhD, Fall 2022
Description:
Please complete your application before August 26th, 2022. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in the United States for the duration of the internship program. 

NOTE: This internship is intended for students who are pursuing a PhD degree with an anticipated graduation date before December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating after December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Student Researcher opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; Ann Arbor, MI, USA; Austin, TX, USA; Chapel Hill, NC, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Irvine, CA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; Madison, WI, USA; New York, NY, USA; Palo Alto, CA, USA; Portland, OR, USA; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; San Bruno, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Washington, DC, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; Princeton, NJ, USA.

Minimum qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a PhD degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or a similar area.).

Preferred qualifications:
Currently attending a degree program in the US.Availability to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university term. Ability to return to a degree program after completion of the internship.Relevant experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.Experience contributing research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages.Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

About The Job

Join us for a full-time, 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building. Research happens across Google everyday, in many different teams. Our research has already impacted user-facing services across Google, including Search, Maps, and Google Now, and is central to the success of Google Cloud and our planet-scale computing, storage, and networking infrastructure.

Research Interns aren't cloistered in the lab, but instead they work closely with Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Interns work on challenges in artificial intelligence, machine perception, data mining, machine learning, natural language understanding, privacy, computer architecture, networking, operating systems, storage and data management, and much more.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

Develop and execute a research agenda. Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Research Scientist, Quantum Error Correction
Description:
Quantinuum is expanding its Quantum Error Correction team in its Cambridge office. As a Research Scientist, you'll work on reducing error rates in quantum states, gates, preparations, measurements, and algorithms. This includes, but is not limited to, improvements in compilation of quantum algorithms into sequences of fault-tolerant operations, the design of quantum error-correcting codes and fault-tolerant circuits, as well as advances in quantum control and device/process characterization. You'll work closely with our hardware and software engineers to integrate error correction into our quantum stack. A key element of the role will be ensuring performance on real quantum hardware.

Based in the Cambridge office, you will be working in a research-focused group with scientific direction from experienced researchers. With the freedom to think independently and creatively, this is an excellent opportunity to advance the theory and practice of quantum computing.

Key Responsibilities
Researching quantum error correction methods and fault-tolerant algorithms to run on real and simulated quantum computersCollaborating with software engineers in the team to implement new techniquesWriting articles and publishing in leading scientific journalsKeeping up-to-date with the literature of the field
Key Requirements
A Ph.D. degree or equivalent – or will have submitted their thesis prior to taking up the position – in Maths, Computer Science, Theoretical Physics or a related disciplineA strong research record showing evidence of their ability to understand the fundamentals of QECC and contribute new ideas
Desirable Skills
Scientific computing, programming in Python, and preferably one or more of: C++, Rust, JuliaCommunicating scientific ideas clearly and precisely, both verbally and in writingWhat is in it for you?

Working alongside a highly talented team, with leading names in the quantum computing industry. We offer a highly competitive package, 28 days of paid holiday (in addition to public holidays), a workplace pension and a positive approach to flexible working.

About Us

Science Led and Enterprise Driven.

Our team of scientists is leading the way in the development of quantum computing. The world’s largest integrated quantum computing company, we united Cambridge Quantum’s advanced software development with Honeywell Quantum Solutions’ high-fidelity hardware to accelerate quantum computing. With full-stack technology, we’re scaling quantum computing and developing applications to solve the world’s most pressing challenges. We could be even better with you!

At Quantinuum, we believe quantum information systems will revolutionize the way we work and live. We are leading the way by helping our customers develop quantum-enabled solutions that provide a competitive-edge in their markets.

We’re hiring the world’s best talent to make it happen. Join us! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ErQOKNC2O38

Please note that employment with us is subject to successfully passing our pre-employment screening checks. We are an inclusive equal opportunity employer. You will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

Title: Student Research Analyst
Description:
Three roles13-month fixed term contractHybrid OverviewThe post holder is responsible for providing analytical support within the R&D directorate and across RSSB. The support covers a broad range of analytical tasks in support of the R&D Directorate and RSSB in delivering value to GB rail through the optimal use of available funding, in line with rail industry, DfT and RSSB objectives. The greatest challenges of the role include building and maintaining a sound understanding of the research landscape, applying a proportionate support to individual analytical tasks depending on their size and criticality, and interpreting the different views and expectations of internal and external stakeholders.
ResponsibilitiesThe scope of potential work is broad, the type of activities will include:Supporting research: Undertaking analysis, engaging with industry stakeholders and helping scope new research projects to be carried out in the rail industry.Providing research support on diverse key industry projects such as further enhancing the industry sustainability, identifying new technology and engineering solutions and improving operational performance of the UK rail network.Horizon Scanning: Identifying future threats and opportunities for the rail industry and monitor cutting edge developments in technology which could be used by rail.Staying abreast of new research, critically evaluating developments, and engaging with industry stakeholders to communicate your findings (recently research has included: quantum computers, drones, programmable magnets, driverless cars, and more).Knowledge searches: Honing your analytical senses and business writing skills to answer questions from members of industry on diverse topics such as: adhesion, trespass, and passenger behaviour. For this desk-based research, you will need to amass information from public sources and read between the lines to find the answers to pressing questions.
QualificationsYou will be studying towards a degree in an engineering discipline, mathematics, economics, data science or machine learning, seeking to take an industrial gap year as part of your higher education and registered as a student or you will be a recent graduateEffective analytical skillsOrganisational skillsEffective communication skillsProactive approach to solving problemsAble to build working relationships with multiple stakeholdersEffective interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate technical information clearly, succinctly and in an engaging way to different audiencesA commitment to RSSB’s values and customer service
Early applications are encouraged, as we may close this vacancy before the advertised deadline if sufficient applications are received.
We value diversity and equal opportunities in employment and are committed to creating a workplace which is inclusive to everyone. As a member of the Disability Confident Scheme, we encourage candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum criteria, to apply for our jobs. If you have applied under the Disability Confident Scheme, please let us know in advance by emailing vacancies@RSSB.CO.UK
If you require any reasonable adjustments with respect to our selection process including information in an alternative format, please contact us at vacancies@rssb.co.uk
We understand the importance of work-life balance and we offer our staff the flexibility to work within our core hours and the option to vary their location between both the office and home. If you are looking for further flexibility, speak to us at interview stage so that we can consider your request.
We value our staff and we offer a competitive benefits package to ensure our staff can achieve their best throughout their journey with us. This includes 30 days annual leave (plus bank holidays); a holiday buy and sell scheme; private medical and dental cover; a season ticket loan and travel subsidy; access to a cycle to work scheme; volunteer leave; a performance related bonus and pension.

Title: Research Staff Member - Quantum (Any Location)
Description:
521558BR

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Quantum Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM Quantum is building an equitable, diverse, and inclusive global quantum computing ecosystem. IBM Quantum is developing full-stack quantum computing, consisting of all relevant hardware and software solutions. We are looking for a researcher to join the “Quantum Algorithms and Complexity Research” team that works on topics such as design and analysis of quantum algorithms, quantum computational complexity theory, formal investigation of quantum advantage, as well as experimental implementation and demonstration of quantum advantage. The focus of the group is on determining areas where quantum computers have a potential advantage, understanding, developing and improving quantum algorithms, and studying quantum computational complexity. Collaboration with other members of the broader IBM Quantum team is encouraged. Responsibilities include developing quantum algorithms, providing formal evidence for quantum advantage, and advancing the understanding of problems that can be sped up by quantum computers.

This position can be located anywhere in the US.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or a closely related fieldProven expertise in quantum computingProven record of research achievements

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

Proven record of design and analysis of quantum algorithmsExperience with rigorous results in quantum computational complexity theory

About Business Unit

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science.

Title: Applied Research Associate - FLARE (Emerging Technologies)
Description:
R&D FLARE Research Associate

Description

JPMorgan Chase's Future Lab for Applied Research and Engineering (FLARE) conducts research in cutting-edge emerging technologies, such as Quantum Computing and Communication, Cloud Computing and Networking, Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR), Internet of Things (IoT), Security and Privacy, Computer Vision, and Edge Computing. Our firm is seeking a passionate technologist to contribute to applied research and development of novel solutions in these fields. As a member of the FLARE R&D team, you will work closely with internal project teams, other researchers, and external communities alike to advance these research focus areas in a way that is beneficial to the technical teams in the company. You will also contribute to the firm's intellectual property by patent applications and scholarly articles.

The Purpose Of Your Role
 To contribute to the conception and delivery of novel solutions to problems faced by internal project teams  To advance the field of Quantum Computing and Communication, in the areas of algorithms and applications (such as Artificial Intelligence, Optimization and Finance) and security  To co-design and implement advanced AR/VR and IoT/5G solutions integrating Security and Privacy enforcement, Computer Vision, and Edge Computing technologies  To help the team augment existing Cloud Computing and Networking solutions with support for multiple cloud infrastructures and seamless integration of cloud-based microservices  To be part of technical partnerships with external organizations, such as academic institutions and leading technology firms  To contribute to JPMC's IP by pursuing necessary protections of generated IP  To help establishing JPMC's reputation in the scientific field via publication of select results in prestigious venues 
The Expertise We Are Looking For
 Industrial research experience within a technology R&D organization, innovation lab, academic institution, or equivalent  Excellent programming skills in languages such as Python, C, C++ and Java  Experience in technical writing in a scientific or technical field, as well as grant applications or research proposals  Working knowledge of common research evaluation frameworks and techniques  Strong passion, awareness and familiarity with emerging technology paradigms  Strong written and visual presentation skills  Ability to work through ambiguity and multiple priorities  Prior hands-on experience as a researcher and developer in a lab is preferred  Familiarity and or experience in financial services is preferred  A B.S. degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or Computer Science is required  A Ph.D. or M.S. degree in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or Computer Science is preferred  Strong knowledge in one or more of the following disciplines: Quantum Computing and Communication, Cloud Computing and Networking, Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR), Internet of Things (IoT), Security and Privacy, Computer Vision, and Edge Computing. 
Travel Requirements
 Up to 10% of travel across strategic hubs, external partner sites, as well as industrial and academic forums 
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The health and safety of our colleagues, candidates, clients and communities has been a top priority in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.

As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

Responsibilities

Develop and execute a research agenda. Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Quantum Scientist with Security Clearance
Description:
Job Number: R0122825 Quantum Scientist

Key Role: Explore and exploit data sources through the use and creation of scientific processes and te chn ologies to uncover and communicate business insights. Apply advanced consulting skills and extensive te chn ical expertise; full industry knowledge. Develop innovative solutions to complex problems. Basic Qualifications: -5+ years of experience with quantum information processing, quantum computing, quantum gate modeling, or superc ond ucting or spin-based semic ond uctor qubit designing, gained during academic internships, doctoral, or post-doctoral studies -Experience with authoring peer-reviewed articles on quantum topics -Ability to work independently on complex tasks - Ability to obtain a security clearance -PhD degree Additional Qualifications: -Experience with project management for scientific projects -Experience with working in a supervisory or advisory position -Experience with programming -Experience with data science, including analysis, data visualization, and machine learning -Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills, including communicating results to te chn ical and non-te chn ical audiences - Secret clearance -PhD degree in Physics, EE, Mathematics, or related te chn ical discipline with an emphasis on quantum information research preferred Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information . We're an EOE that empowers our people-no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic-to fearlessly drive change.

Title: Technology Research Analyst
Description:
Address

100 King Street West

Job Family Group

Technology

This is a technology research and consulting role where you would be responsible for researching and monitoring of emerging technologies (blockchain, quantum, etc.). This includes their technological capabilities, industry applications, market trends and relevant landscape (regulatory, etc.). You will be driving insights for consumption by leadership and broader BMO community, and work with partners in digital ecosystem across academia, governments and industry partners on various research projects and gather new technology trends and applications. Providing management consulting services and technology/industry expertise in support of business and enterprise adoption of emerging technologies is also a key part of this role..

KEY Dynamic Opportunities Include

Provide measurable value to leaders and BMO community through; high-quality research of ongoing developments in various emerging technologies (blockchain, quantum, AR/VR, etc.) and technology driven market trends (open banking, digital ID, etc.), and advise BMO leaders and community on trends and industry directions.Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners on evaluating specific technology capabilities and or to analyze a market trend. Provide analytical support to other T&O partners on technology research initiatives.Compile and build of research papers, Point of Views and training content for publication on emerging technology research and market trends. as well as through providing knowledge sharing workshops and training sessions. Identify technology trends and proposing research topics related to financial technologies and digital ecosystems. Contribute as a subject matter expert to our research agenda and develop TR&I technology research blueprintsLeverage research and insights to support businesses and areas during emerging technology exploration and adoption initiatives. Work with ecosystem partners on research projects and experiment technologies that have applicability in financial service. Establish networks with these partners to gather new technology trends and practices.
Role Mandate

This is a technology research and consultative role. The candidate will be supporting the research of emerging technologies, monitoring of market and regulatory developments, and applicability in the financial services industry, to support the advancement of innovation across BMO. The candidate will work with industry, academia and government partners in the digital ecosystem across on various research projects to gather hands-on intelligence on new technology concepts, exploration and applications. The candidate will also assist in providing management consulting services and technology/industry advice to internal executive-level stakeholders in support of enterprise adoption of such technologies.

Key Accountabilities

As an Associate/Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, innovators and solution providers to advance the innovation agenda at BMO. Responsibilities include:

Conduct high-quality research and analysis of various emerging technologies, digital trends and topics such as distributed ledger technologies/Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, and other emerging topics including (but not limited to) Open Banking, Cloud, Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality (AR/VR) and Internet of Things (IoT) to drive insights for consumption by BMO leadership and broader communitySupport the development of research papers for publication that summarize research of emerging technologies and monitoring of market trends and developments. This includes research of market and competitive landscape, vendor and solution capabilitiesHelp advise BMO leaders and community on trends and industry directions through various communication channels and platformsCollaborate with internal stakeholders and external partners on evaluating specific technology capabilities, and provide analytical support to other T&O partners on technology research initiativesLeverage research and insights to support businesses and areas during emerging technology exploration and adoption initiativesFacilitate knowledge sharing workshops, awareness sessions and various innovation events for internal BMO employees to develop the right skills and mindset required to harness the power of emerging technologies across the bankWork with ecosystem partners on research projects and experiment with technologies with potential applicability to the financial service industry
Qualifications/Requirements

Technical background: University degree in quantitative disciplines (software engineering, computer/computational sciences, Math/Statistics) or equivalentExperience: 2+ years in business analysis, management/technology consulting role or equivalent; big 4 firms experience is an assetDomain knowledge: Enterprise-level knowledge of any of the emerging technology domains such as distributed ledger technologies/Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Robotic Process Automation or other emerging topics such as Open Banking, Cloud, Internet of Things (IoT) or equivalent; certifications are an assetPassion for learning: Eagerness to learn various technologies and subjects, open to change, exploration, trial and error, and embracing failure with big picture in mindAdaptive working mindset: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, maintain focus and prioritize work in a dynamic, fast-paced and at times ambiguous and pressurized environmentProactive and result-oriented: Self-starter with very good organization skills who thrives in a deadline driven environment; Proactive, “can do” mindsetPresentation: Very good presentation skills including ability to put together structured, clean and effective presentation decks that tell a story to executive-level audience; Proficiency with MS Office Suite specifically PowerPoint and Excel is an assetCommunication: Very good verbal and written communication skills including ability to tailor communication to different audiences varying in level of seniority
Core Competencies

Passion for emerging technologies and innovation, Digital advocate, Team player; Strong Analytical skills, Ability to manage ambiguity, Executes Efficiently, Shows Initiative, Solicits Support, Strategizes and Develops, Communicates Effectively
We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Research Fellow, Quantum Information Processing, Centre For Quantum Technologies
Description:
About The Centre For Quantum Technologies

The Centre for Quantum Technologies (CQT) is a research centre of excellence in Singapore. It brings together physicists, computer scientists and engineers to do basic research on quantum physics and to build devices based on quantum phenomena. Experts in this new discipline of quantum technologies are applying their discoveries in computing, communications, and sensing.

CQT is hosted by the National University of Singapore and also has staff at Nanyang Technological University. With some 180 researchers and students, it offers a friendly and international work environment.

Learn more about CQT at ***************

Job Description

The successful candidate will work as part of a collaborative programme between the Centre for Quantum Technologies and Oxford University to develop quantum dot-based quantum light sources for distributed photonic networks for future quantum information processing.

Significant experience of quantum optics or spectroscopy of devices, materials, or nanomaterials is essential and should be accompanied with a demonstrable track record of assembling and operating optical set-ups, lasers, APDs, time-resolved spectroscopy, helium flow cryostats, and control software (e.g. Labview). Knowledge of exciton dynamics and material synthesis is an advantage because the appointee will be expected to contribute to sample fabrication. The appointment is for an initial period of one year, renewable subject to performance.

Job Requirements
Applicants should possess or be close to obtaining a PhD in physics or materials science.Highly experienced in the optoelectronic characterisation of devices, materials, and nanomaterials.Experience with optical spectroscopy.Experience with laboratory experimental automation software, particularly LabVIEW.Good track record of high-quality publications.Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.Applicants should be highly motivated and have excellent skills in working collaboratively as part of a team.The ability to direct your own research and interpret your results independently.Applicants are expected to openly share information pertaining to their research with other group members and contribute to scientific discussions concerning their and other group members’ work.Experience with time-resolved spectroscopy of materials.Experience with handling cryogens and work at low temperatures.Experience with experiments and/or analysis related to single photon countingExperience working with wet-bench chemistry for material synthesis
More Information

For enquiries and details about the position, please contact Tristan Farrow at *****@nus.edu.sg .

Please include your consent by filling in the NUS Personal Data Consent for Job Applicants.

Employment Type: Full-time

Applications can be submitted via the link below and should contain: the latest CV, and letter of recommendation (if any).

Job requisition ID: [[11859]]

Additional Information

At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students is one of our utmost priorities and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require significant amount of physical interactions with student / staff / public members. Even for job roles that can be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presence is required.

With effect from 15 January 2022, based on Singapore’s legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able work at the NUS premises. As such, we regret to inform that job applicants need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated for successful employment with NUS.

MOM Updated advisory on COVID-vaccination at the Workplace, subject to changes in accordance with the national COVID-19 measures

Qualification

Not Specified
